attributes.action: Make sure the 231 bus between Huddersfield and wakefield doesn't get cancelled
attributes.additional_details:
There are quite a lot of people that really on these buses elderly and disabled they get cancelled on a daily basis and when I have contacted arriva they have said to me we do not give a toss and its just tough look
According to the government guidelines of running a bus service you are not allowed to cancel buses that are only 1 per hour without 10 days notice when I have said this to Arriva they have told me as they are a limited company they don't have to abige by any government rules
attributes.background:
The 231 is only 1 per hour Monday to Friday and 1 ever 2 hours on a Sunday they have also just changed the Saturday to 1 ever 2 hours 
I want to make sure that arriva West Yorkshire are not allowed to cancel theses buses

rejection.details:
Decisions about local bus routes are a matter for individual transport operators and the relevant local authority, not the Government or Parliament.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
